conclusion: Analyze the circuit in two scenarios: switch open and closed.
The voltmeter reads 6V when the switch is open.
The voltmeter is connected across the 20Ω resistor.
Voltage drop across the 20Ω resistor is 6V.
Calculate current using Ohm's Law: I = 0.3A.
Current flows through both 20Ω and 10Ω resistors in series.
Total voltage across points a and b when open is 9V.
When switch is closed, 10Ω resistor is short-circuited.
Entire current flows through 20Ω resistor and variable resistor R.
Equivalent resistance when switch is closed is 20Ω + R.
Calculate current through circuit: I = ε / (20Ω + R).
Voltage across 20Ω resistor is ε × 20Ω / (20Ω + R).
Voltage between points a and b is same as across 20Ω resistor.
Voltage across points a and b when closed is 6V.
